command.name: archive
command.help:
The archive command creates an archive of the specified format
containing the files and directories of the Composer project or the specified
package in the specified version and writes it to the specified directory.

php composer.phar archive [--format=zip] [--dir=/foo] [package [version]]

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#archive

Options:
--format(-f)Format of the resulting archive: tar or zip
--dirWrite the archive to this directory
--fileWrite the archive with the given file name. Note that the format will be appended.
--ignore-filtersIgnore filters when saving package
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

option.name: --format
option.help: Format of the resulting archive: tar or zip

option.name: --dir
option.help: Write the archive to this directory

option.name: --file
option.help: Write the archive with the given file name. Note that the format will be appended.

command.name: auto-scripts
command.help:
The run-script command runs scripts defined in composer.json:

php composer.phar run-script post-update-cmd

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#run-script

Options:
--devSets the dev mode.
--no-devDisables the dev mode.

command.name: browse
command.help:
The home command opens or shows a package's repository URL or
homepage in your default browser.

To open the homepage by default, use -H or --homepage.
To show instead of open the repository or homepage URL, use -s or --show.

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#browse-home

Options:
--homepage(-H)Open the homepage instead of the repository URL.
--show(-s)Only show the homepage or repository URL.
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

command.name: check-platform-reqs
command.help:
Checks that your PHP and extensions versions match the platform requirements of the installed packages.

Unlike update/install, this command will ignore config.platform settings and check the real platform packages so you can be certain you have the required platform dependencies.

php composer.phar check-platform-reqs


Options:
--no-devDisables checking of require-dev packages requirements.
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

command.name: config
command.help:
This command allows you to edit composer config settings and repositories
in either the local composer.json file or the global config.json file.

Additionally it lets you edit most properties in the local composer.json.

To set a config setting:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config bin-dir bin/

To read a config setting:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config bin-dir
Outputs: bin

To edit the global config.json file:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config --global

To add a repository:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config repositories.foo vcs https://bar.com

To remove a repository (repo is a short alias for repositories):

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config --unset repo.foo

To disable packagist:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config repo.packagist false

You can alter repositories in the global config.json file by passing in the
--global option.

To add or edit suggested packages you can use:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config suggest.package reason for the suggestion

To add or edit extra properties you can use:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config extra.property value

To edit the file in an external editor:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config --editor

To choose your editor you can set the "EDITOR" env variable.

To get a list of configuration values in the file:

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config --list

You can always pass more than one option. As an example, if you want to edit the
global config.json file.

C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar config --editor --global

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#config

Options:
--global(-g)Apply command to the global config file
--editor(-e)Open editor
--auth(-a)Affect auth config file (only used for --editor)
--unsetUnset the given setting-key
--list(-l)List configuration settings
--file(-f)If you want to choose a different composer.json or config.json
--absoluteReturns absolute paths when fetching *-dir config values instead of relative
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

option.help: Apply command to the global config file

option.name: --auth
option.help: Affect auth config file (only used for --editor)

option.name: --file
option.help: If you want to choose a different composer.json or config.json

option.name: --absolute
option.help: Returns absolute paths when fetching *-dir config values instead of relative

option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

command.name: create-project
command.help:
The create-project command creates a new project from a given
package into a new directory. If executed without params and in a directory
with a composer.json file it installs the packages for the current project.

You can use this command to bootstrap new projects or setup a clean
version-controlled installation for developers of your project.

php composer.phar create-project vendor/project target-directory [version]

You can also specify the version with the package name using = or : as separator.

php composer.phar create-project vendor/project:version target-directory

To install unstable packages, either specify the version you want, or use the
--stability=dev (where dev can be one of RC, beta, alpha or dev).

To setup a developer workable version you should create the project using the source
controlled code by appending the '--prefer-source' flag.

To install a package from another repository than the default one you
can pass the '--repository=https://myrepository.org' flag.

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#create-project

Options:
--stability(-s)Minimum-stability allowed (unless a version is specified).
--prefer-sourceForces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.
--prefer-distForces installation from package dist even for dev versions.
--repositoryPick a different repository (as url or json config) to look for the package.
--repository-urlDEPRECATED: Use --repository instead.
--add-repositoryAdd the repository option to the composer.json.
--devEnables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).
--no-devDisables installation of require-dev packages.
--no-custom-installersDEPRECATED: Use no-plugins instead.
--no-scriptsWhether to prevent execution of all defined scripts in the root package.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--no-secure-httpDisable the secure-http config option temporarily while installing the root package. Use at your own risk. Using this flag is a bad idea.
--keep-vcsWhether to prevent deleting the vcs folder.
--remove-vcsWhether to force deletion of the vcs folder without prompting.
--no-installWhether to skip installation of the package dependencies.
--ignore-platform-reqsIgnore platform requirements (php & ext- packages).
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

option.help: Minimum-stability allowed (unless a version is specified).

command.name: diagnose
command.help:
The diagnose command checks common errors to help debugging problems.

The process exit code will be 1 in case of warnings and 2 for errors.

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#diagnose

php composer.phar dump-autoload

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#dump-autoload-dumpautoload-

--optimize(-o)Optimizes PSR0 and PSR4 packages to be loaded with classmaps too, good for production.
--classmap-authoritative(-a)Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize`.
--apcuUse APCu to cache found/not-found classes.
--no-devDisables autoload-dev rules.

command.name: global
command.help:
Use this command as a wrapper to run other Composer commands
within the global context of COMPOSER_HOME.

You can use this to install CLI utilities globally, all you need
is to add the COMPOSER_HOME/vendor/bin dir to your PATH env var.

COMPOSER_HOME is c:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\Composer on Windows
and /home//.composer on unix systems.

If your system uses freedesktop.org standards, then it will first check
XDG_CONFIG_HOME or default to /home//.config/composer

Note: This path may vary depending on customizations to bin-dir in
composer.json or the environmental variable COMPOSER_BIN_DIR.

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#global

Options:

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

command.name: help
command.help:
The help command displays help for a given command:

php C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar help list

You can also output the help in other formats by using the --format option:

php C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar help --format=xml list

To display the list of available commands, please use the list command.

Options:
--xmlTo output help as XML
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--rawTo output raw command help

command.name: init
command.help:
The init command creates a basic composer.json file
in the current directory.

php composer.phar init

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#init

Options:
--nameName of the package
--descriptionDescription of package
--authorAuthor name of package
--typeType of package (e.g. library, project, metapackage, composer-plugin)
--homepageHomepage of package
--requirePackage to require with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"
--require-devPackage to require for development with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"
--stability(-s)Minimum stability (empty or one of: stable, RC, beta, alpha, dev)
--license(-l)License of package
--repositoryAdd custom repositories, either by URL or using JSON arrays
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

option.name: --type
option.help: Type of package (e.g. library, project, metapackage, composer-plugin)

option.name: --require
option.help: Package to require with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"

option.name: --require-dev
option.help: Package to require for development with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"

option.name: --stability
option.help: Minimum stability (empty or one of: stable, RC, beta, alpha, dev)

option.name: --repository
option.help: Add custom repositories, either by URL or using JSON arrays

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

option.name: --profile
option.help: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.help: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: install
command.help:
The install command reads the composer.lock file from
the current directory, processes it, and downloads and installs all the
libraries and dependencies outlined in that file. If the file does not
exist it will look for composer.json and do the same.

php composer.phar install

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#install-i

Options:
--prefer-sourceForces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.
--prefer-distForces installation from package dist even for dev versions.
--dry-runOutputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
--devEnables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).
--no-devDisables installation of require-dev packages.
--no-custom-installersDEPRECATED: Use no-plugins instead.
--no-autoloaderSkips autoloader generation
--no-scriptsSkips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--no-suggestDo not show package suggestions.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--optimize-autoloader(-o)Optimize autoloader during autoloader dump
--classmap-authoritative(-a)Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize-autoloader`.
--apcu-autoloaderUse APCu to cache found/not-found classes.
--ignore-platform-reqsIgnore platform requirements (php & ext- packages).

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

command.name: list
command.help:
The list command lists all commands:

php C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar list

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

php C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar list test

You can also output the information in other formats by using the --format option:

php C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar list --format=xml

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

php C:\Users\DELL\Downloads\CheckUp\CheckUp\composer.phar list --raw

Options:
--xmlTo output list as XML
--rawTo output raw command list
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --format
option.help: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

command.name: outdated
command.help:
The outdated command is just a proxy for `composer show -l`

The color coding (or signage if you have ANSI colors disabled) for dependency versions is as such:

- green (=): Dependency is in the latest version and is up to date.
- yellow (~): Dependency has a new version available that includes backwards
compatibility breaks according to semver, so upgrade when you can but it
may involve work.
- red (!): Dependency has a new version that is semver-compatible and you should upgrade it.

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#outdated

Options:
--outdated(-o)Show only packages that are outdated (this is the default, but present here for compat with `show`
--all(-a)Show all installed packages with their latest versions
--direct(-D)Shows only packages that are directly required by the root package
--strictReturn a non-zero exit code when there are outdated packages
--minor-only(-m)Show only packages that have minor SemVer-compatible updates. Use with the --outdated option.
--format(-f)Format of the output: text or json
--ignoreIgnore specified package(s). Use it with the --outdated option if you don't want to be informed about new versions of some packages.
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

command.name: remove
command.help:
The remove command removes a package from the current
list of installed packages

php composer.phar remove

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#remove

Options:

--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--no-updateDisables the automatic update of the dependencies.
--no-scriptsSkips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.
--update-no-devRun the dependency update with the --no-dev option.
--update-with-dependenciesAllows inherited dependencies to be updated with explicit dependencies. (Deprecrated, is now default behavior)
--no-update-with-dependenciesDoes not allow inherited dependencies to be updated with explicit dependencies.
--ignore-platform-reqsIgnore platform requirements (php & ext- packages).
--optimize-autoloader(-o)Optimize autoloader during autoloader dump
--classmap-authoritative(-a)Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize-autoloader`.
--apcu-autoloaderUse APCu to cache found/not-found classes.

command.name: require
command.help:
The require command adds required packages to your composer.json and installs them.

If you do not specify a package, composer will prompt you to search for a package, and given results, provide a list of
matches to require.

If you do not specify a version constraint, composer will choose a suitable one based on the available package versions.

If you do not want to install the new dependencies immediately you can call it with --no-update

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#require

Options:
--devAdd requirement to require-dev.
--prefer-sourceForces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.
--prefer-distForces installation from package dist even for dev versions.
--fixedWrite fixed version to the composer.json.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--no-suggestDo not show package suggestions.
--no-updateDisables the automatic update of the dependencies.
--no-scriptsSkips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.
--update-no-devRun the dependency update with the --no-dev option.
--update-with-dependenciesAllows inherited dependencies to be updated, except those that are root requirements.
--update-with-all-dependenciesAllows all inherited dependencies to be updated, including those that are root requirements.
--ignore-platform-reqsIgnore platform requirements (php & ext- packages).
--prefer-stablePrefer stable versions of dependencies.
--prefer-lowestPrefer lowest versions of dependencies.
--sort-packagesSorts packages when adding/updating a new dependency
--optimize-autoloader(-o)Optimize autoloader during autoloader dump
--classmap-authoritative(-a)Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize-autoloader`.
--apcu-autoloaderUse APCu to cache found/not-found classes.
--no-unpack[DEPRECATED] Disable unpacking Symfony packs in composer.json.
--unpack[DEPRECATED] Unpacking is now enabled by default.

command.help:
The self-update command checks getcomposer.org for newer
versions of composer and if found, installs the latest.

php composer.phar self-update

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#self-update-selfupdate-

--stableForce an update to the stable channel
--previewForce an update to the preview channel
--snapshotForce an update to the snapshot channel
--set-channel-onlyOnly store the channel as the default one and then exit

command.name: show
command.help:
The show command displays detailed information about a package, or
lists all packages available.

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#show

Options:
--allList all packages
--installed(-i)List installed packages only (enabled by default, only present for BC).
--platform(-p)List platform packages only
--available(-a)List available packages only
--self(-s)Show the root package information
--name-only(-N)List package names only
--path(-P)Show package paths
--tree(-t)List the dependencies as a tree
--latest(-l)Show the latest version
--outdated(-o)Show the latest version but only for packages that are outdated
--ignoreIgnore specified package(s). Use it with the --outdated option if you don't want to be informed about new versions of some packages.
--minor-only(-m)Show only packages that have minor SemVer-compatible updates. Use with the --outdated option.
--direct(-D)Shows only packages that are directly required by the root package
--strictReturn a non-zero exit code when there are outdated packages
--format(-f)Format of the output: text or json

--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.

--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

command.name: update
command.help:
The update command reads the composer.json file from the
current directory, processes it, and updates, removes or installs all the
dependencies.

php composer.phar update

To limit the update operation to a few packages, you can list the package(s)
you want to update as such:

php composer.phar update vendor/package1 foo/mypackage [...]

You may also use an asterisk (*) pattern to limit the update operation to package(s)
from a specific vendor:

php composer.phar update vendor/package1 foo/* [...]

To select packages names interactively with auto-completion use -i.

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#update-u

Options:
--prefer-sourceForces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.
--prefer-distForces installation from package dist even for dev versions.
--dry-runOutputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
--devEnables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).
--no-devDisables installation of require-dev packages.
--lockOnly updates the lock file hash to suppress warning about the lock file being out of date.
--no-custom-installersDEPRECATED: Use no-plugins instead.
--no-autoloaderSkips autoloader generation
--no-scriptsSkips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--no-suggestDo not show package suggestions.
--with-dependenciesAdd also dependencies of whitelisted packages to the whitelist, except those defined in root package.
--with-all-dependenciesAdd also all dependencies of whitelisted packages to the whitelist, including those defined in root package.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--optimize-autoloader(-o)Optimize autoloader during autoloader dump.
--classmap-authoritative(-a)Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize-autoloader`.
--apcu-autoloaderUse APCu to cache found/not-found classes.
--ignore-platform-reqsIgnore platform requirements (php & ext- packages).
--prefer-stablePrefer stable versions of dependencies.
--prefer-lowestPrefer lowest versions of dependencies.
--interactive(-i)Interactive interface with autocompletion to select the packages to update.
--root-reqsRestricts the update to your first degree dependencies.
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

option.name: --prefer-source
option.help: Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.

option.name: --prefer-dist
option.help: Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions.

option.name: --dry-run
option.help: Outputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).

option.name: --dev
option.help: Enables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).

option.name: --lock
option.help: Only updates the lock file hash to suppress warning about the lock file being out of date.

option.name: --no-scripts
option.help: Skips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.

option.name: --with-dependencies
option.help: Add also dependencies of whitelisted packages to the whitelist, except those defined in root package.

option.name: --with-all-dependencies
option.help: Add also all dependencies of whitelisted packages to the whitelist, including those defined in root package.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --classmap-authoritative
option.help: Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize-autoloader`.

option.name: --apcu-autoloader
option.help: Use APCu to cache found/not-found classes.

option.name: --interactive
option.help: Interactive interface with autocompletion to select the packages to update.

option.name: --root-reqs
option.help: Restricts the update to your first degree dependencies.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

option.name: --profile
option.help: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.help: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: validate
command.help:
The validate command validates a given composer.json and composer.lock

Exit codes in case of errors are:
1 validation warning(s), only when --strict is given
2 validation error(s)
3 file unreadable or missing

Read more at https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#validate

Options:
--no-check-allDo not validate requires for overly strict/loose constraints
--no-check-lockDo not check if lock file is up to date
--no-check-publishDo not check for publish errors
--with-dependencies(-A)Also validate the composer.json of all installed dependencies
--strictReturn a non-zero exit code for warnings as well as errors
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

option.name: --no-check-all
option.help: Do not validate requires for overly strict/loose constraints

option.name: --no-check-lock
option.help: Do not check if lock file is up to date

option.name: --no-check-publish
option.help: Do not check for publish errors

option.name: --with-dependencies
option.help: Also validate the composer.json of all installed dependencies

option.name: --strict
option.help: Return a non-zero exit code for warnings as well as errors

command.name: symfony:recipes:install
command.help:
Installs or reinstalls recipes for already installed packages.

Options:
--forceOverwrite existing files when a new version of a recipe is available
--resetReset all recipes back to their initial state (should be combined with --force)
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-cachePrevent use of the cache

option.name: --force
option.help: Overwrite existing files when a new version of a recipe is available

option.name: --reset
option.help: Reset all recipes back to their initial state (should be combined with --force)
